```{r}
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(scales)
library(forcats)
```


```{r}
df <- read.csv('./resources/data_combined_filtered.csv')
df <- df %>% filter(group != 'newsmedia') %>% select(c(created_at, screen_name, text, retweet_count, quote_count, reply_count, followers_count, group))
```

```{r}
df <- df %>% group_by(group) %>% summarise(followers_count = sum(followers_count))
```

```{r}
ggplot(df, aes(x=reorder(group, -followers_count), y= followers_count/1000000000)) + 
  geom_bar(stat='identity', fill="lightblue") + 
  scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +
  ggtitle("Twitter Followers") +
  ylab("Followers Count (in billion)") +
  xlab("Group") +
  geom_text(aes(label=comma(followers_count)), vjust=2)
```
